title: Instructional Design (ID) Process for Designing and Implementing Distance Education Operation Models

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Systematic approach to remote education operations in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments for corporate university administrators

learning_goals: Learners will analyze corporate learner profiles (age, role, digital literacy) and organizational environments (tech infrastructure, budget, work culture) to produce a 5-page remote education feasibility report. The report must include: 1) learner needs analysis, 2) tech infrastructure assessment, 3) budget planning, 4) organizational culture alignment, with 5-point scale evaluation tables for each section.
Develop a remote education operation model based on the five stages of instructional design (ID): analysis, design, development, implementation, and evaluation

Learners will develop a math education content plan for corporate learners aged 40+ in limited ICT environments (text-based platforms, low-spec devices). The plan must: 1) design ≥2 weekly text-based feedback channels for learner-instructor interaction, 2) apply a 3-tier difficulty adjustment system, 3) achieve ≥80% learner satisfaction survey results.
Formulate and implement remote education operation strategies considering security and infrastructure challenges

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
